result.execSummary:
The defendant Davante D Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge.   To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds/earnings.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime  or part time employment of at least 20 hours per week.
Mental health evaluation.  Comply with recommended treatment/counseling.

No association with any gang members.
No contact with any person or place where drugs are sold, used, or packaged for sale.

Comply with all rules as set forth by agent.
Provide prescription to agent before filling them and take only prescribed medications.
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample to Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davante D Howard

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (47 pages) commencing 01.07.2016 by NANCY CZERNIEJEWSKI.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf
Letter from the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Davante D Howard in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Davante D Howard in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Court copy of the criminal complaint not in file. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 4-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed in Branch 35 on 10/14/15.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Davante D Howard not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in trial and unable to conduct plea ansd sentencing hearing today. No spin Court available.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Davante D Howard not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-14-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Davante D Howard not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 07-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davante D Howard in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Davante D Howard in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF722 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Keller-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Davante D Howard in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Davante D Howard in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
